WRITING.TEXT:
This is the first time I've been on here in a really long time. I wanted to share some pics of me that I took around 2-3 weeks ago since I don't have any recent. But this is me about a month into recovery. I feel like I don't really have an eating disorder since I wasn't bad enough to have to do inpatient, but I dunno. Its a huge struggle. I feel like I wasnt skinny enough for doctors to worry about me. :( I can see that I'm skinny in my stomach usually but my thighs look huge to me. http://imgur.com/rgD4a2f http://imgur.com/SXcevp2
edit: also these stats are super old. When I started recovery I was 45kg but idk what I am now

WRITING.TITLE: How do I know what does and does not apply to me?
WRITING.TEXT: I've been dealing with extreme hunger, but yet I still feel like I'm not "anorexic enough" to give into it. I got down to a BMI of about 17, which to me was just barely under the underweight mark. I've been dealing with a restrictive eating disorder for about three years now. I don't have my period and I've experienced low heart rate, mild malnutrition, thinning of hair, drying of skin, and faintness on a regular basis due to my eating disorder. I don't get to see my doctor, therapist, and dietician for another few weeks as I'm studying abroad. I'm getting about 20,000 steps in a day so I'm a lot more active, though my meal plan was changed to add a snack to accommodate this. However, even when following my meal plan I'm still just so hungry. Does the general rule of 2500-3500 apply to me and should i give into extreme hunger? I feel as though because i'm not really in intensive outpatient or inpatient my anorexia nervosa is only "mild" and I don't need to really recover much. Any advice is appreciated, thanks!
After opening up to my mom about how miserable I am and that I needed help she told me: "You fucking frighten me"
In the same boat, except prom is tomorrow ):

I used to fast on Wednesdays. It wasn't the best experience in the world physically, but mentally it made me feel way better about myself. Though it would cause me to eat more on Thursdays, and I think had i restricted normally I would've lost more weight. It wasn't something worth sticking with.

"Take your vitamins. Eat lunch, you should've had breakfast. No wait don't do that, you want to keep losing weight remember? No wait don't do that. Eat lunch, you're too skinny and your loved ones seem concerned. Ew God wait no you're too fat, skip lunch too."

I feel this, but on the other hand, I can't help but think I'd feel more guilty knowing there's someone out there going through the pain I am, and using my body to fuel that self hatred. It makes me feel selfish and impure. I want to suffer because I hate myself, not because I want to make others hate themselves more.
My thoughts exactly. Having no sense of style is not a "neutral look". The way he describes his wardrobe makes him sound like an awkward middle school boy.
I've been told pear and hourglass. My measurements are 33-22.5-33, though after eating my waist gets up to 24 :(
Wonderful! :) I have those same socks, and lots of others from that brand. They're so cute aren't they?
